value.title: Privacy fears as Indian city Lucknow readies facial recognition to spot harassed women
value.excerpt: Concerns that technology will lead to intrusive policing and privacy violations, digital rights experts warned.

value.title: Ban on facial recognition technology by Minneapolis police advances
value.excerpt: A proposal to ban the use of facial recognition technology by Minneapolis police and other city departments is advancing. A council committee advanced the measure Thursday which will go to the full council Feb.

value.title: Democrats ask ethics panel to investigate Sens. Ted Cruz, Josh Hawley
value.excerpt: WASHINGTON (AP) — Seven Democratic senators on Thursday asked Ethics Committee to investigate the actions of Republican Sens. Ted Cruz and Josh Hawley “to fully understand their role” in the Jan. 6 insurrection at the Capitol by supporters of former President Donald Trump.

value.title: Computer Vision Market 2020 to 2025|Rising Demand, Share, Trends, Growth, Opportunities

value.title: Technologists Use Facial Recognition on Parler Videos
value.excerpt: Technologists have used facial recognition techniques on the large archive of Parler videos filmed from the January 6 Capitol riots, Motherboard has learned. In some cases they have been able to track individual faces across different videos,

value.title: Paravision AI ordered to delete face recognition software derived from user pictures without permission
value.excerpt: US face recognition developer has been found to have used pictures from the Ever storage app without permission, and now has to delete all its algorithms.

value.title: Facebook uses AI to improve photo descriptions for the visually impaired
value.excerpt: One of the most common types of content shared on Facebook, and other social media platforms are photographs. While most social media users can look at an image and see what it represents,

value.title: Apple patents next gen Face ID, which uses facial heat mapping
value.excerpt: Apple has just been granted a new patent that is related to its Face ID biometric security system. The patent details a next gen advancement in facial recognition technology, which apparently uses facial heat mapping for authentication.

value.title: Twenty20 Solutions introduces edge AI face biometrics and object recognition
value.excerpt: Twenty20 Solutions is now able to provide cutting-edge face biometrics and object recognition solutions powered by advanced machine learning methods.

value.title: Opinion: Facial Recognition Vital to Nab Capitol Assailants
value.excerpt: While cities ranging from San Francisco to Boston have worked to ban facial recognition outright, without that technology, the FBI and Capitol Police would have had a harder job arresting the Capitol insurrectionists.

value.title: 14 Tech Products From CES 2021 I Can’t Wait To Buy

value.title: Google launches suite of AI-powered solutions for retailers
value.excerpt: Google's new Product Discovery Solutions for Retail aims to address ecommerce challenges during the pandemic with AI and machine learning.

value.title: Delhi Airport evaluating 'computer vision' technology to track passengers: CEO
value.excerpt: Delhi Airport is evaluating computer vision technology to track passengers, reduce waiting time and ensure social distancing at terminals, a top official of the facility's operator informed | NewsByte

value.title: U.S. lawmakers aim to curtail face recognition even as the technology IDs Capitol attackers
value.excerpt: U.S. lawmakers are moving ahead with efforts to ban facial recognition software even as the technology helps identify supporters of President Donald Trump who ransacked their workplace and forced them to evacuate this month.

value.title: Startups look beyond lidar for autonomous vehicle perception
value.excerpt: Last CES was a time of reckoning for lidar companies, many of which were cratering due to a lack of demand from a (still) non-existent autonomous vehicle industry. The few that excelled did so by specializing,

value.title: LAPD Commission OKs Detectives to Use Facial Recognition
value.excerpt: Under the new policy, detectives can use the facial recognition database to help them in criminal investigations, and when they need to identify incapacitated, unconscious or dead people.

value.title: Stanford team behind BS gaydar AI says facial recognition can expose political orientation
value.excerpt: Stanford researcher Michael Kosinski, the PhD behind the infamous “Gaydar” AI, is back with another phrenology-adjacent (his team swears it’s not phrenology) bit of pseudo-scientific ridiculousness. This time,

value.title: The best facial recognition security cameras for 2021
value.excerpt: Some home security cameras have facial recognition, an advanced feature that lets you make a database of people who regularly come to your house. Then, when the camera sees a face, it determines whether or not it belongs to someone in your list of known faces.

value.title: Security software maker Tufin soars on raised Q4 outlook
value.excerpt: The company named software industry veteran Ray Brancato, formerly of CA Technologies, among others, as its chief revenue officer.

value.title: The Promise and Peril of Facial Recognition
value.excerpt: Agencies are using the technology to identify the Capitol rioters.

value.title: Tesla’s main self-driving rival isn’t Google—it’s Intel’s Mobileye
value.excerpt: Mobileye's self-driving strategy has a number of things in common with that of Tesla, the world's most valuable automaker. Like Tesla, Mobileye is aiming to gradually evolve its current driver-assistance technology into a fully self-driving system.

value.title: Chinese facial recognition unicorn Megvii prepares China IPO
value.excerpt: Megvii, one of China’s largest facial recognition startups, is gearing up for an initial public offering in Shanghai. The company is working with CITIC Securities to prepare for its planned listing, according to an announcement posted by the China Securities Regulatory Commission on Tuesday.

value.title: Job Screening Service Halts Facial Analysis of Applicants
value.excerpt: HireVue, a leading provider of software for vetting job candidates based on an algorithmic assessment, said Tuesday it is killing off a controversial feature of its software: analyzing a person’s facial expressions in a video to discern certain characteristics.

value.title: CES Liveblog: Laptops, Robovacs, and Lab-Grown Breast Milk
value.excerpt: The consumer tech show is virtual this year, and the WIRED Gear crew is watching all the Zooms to bring you up-to-the-minute highlights of news from CES.

value.title: How far can facial recognition go in finding rioters in D.C.?
value.excerpt: Photos and videos from the riot are all over the internet, and law enforcement can use them to help find criminals; but one face doesn't make the case.

value.title: Roboflow raises $2.1M for its end-to-end computer vision platform
value.excerpt: Roboflow, a startup that aims to simplify the process of building computer vision models, today announced that it has raised a $2.1 million seed round co-led by Lachy Groom and Craft Ventures. Additional investors include Segment co-founder Calvin French-Owen,

value.title: Programming tweak helps AI software imitate human visual learning
value.excerpt: Using a novel programming tweak, a pair of neuroscientists have managed to replicate human visual learning in computer-based artificial intelligence.

value.title: A Startup Will Nix Algorithms Built on Ill-Gotten Facial Data
value.excerpt: San Francisco face-recognition startup Everalbum won a $2 million contract with the Air Force to provide “AI-driven access control.” Monday, another arm of the US government dealt the company a setback.
